required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamic Effects of KUR-101 in Healthy Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Randomized, Double-Blind, Two Part Study of the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Analgesic and Respiratory Effect of KUR-101 in Healthy Adult Participants

brief_summary.textblock:
This project is testing the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK, the amount of study drug in your blood) and pharmacodynamics (PD, how the study drug affects your body) of single doses of a new drug called KUR-101.
Up to 58 healthy men or women aged between 18-55 will be enrolled in this study in two parts.
Part 1 will involve a single ascending (increasing) dose (SAD) where 40 participants (5 groups of 8) will be randomised (assigned randomly, like flipping a coin) to receive a single oral dose of the study drug or placebo. The placebo will look the same as the study drug but will not contain any medicine.
Part 2: will involve a crossover design where 18 participants will be randomised to receive a single oral dose of each of three interventions (study drug, placebo or a marketed form of oxycodone). Each dose is separated by 7 days and the participants are randomised so they do not know the order of the interventions.
For Part 1 the total participation will last 9 days, of which 4 days (3 nights) will be spent in the clinic. One group of subjects in Part 1 will return to the clinic to receive a second dose of drug given with a high fat breakfast. In this group, the total participation will last 16 days, of which 8 days (7 nights) will be spent in the clinic.
For Part 2 the total participation will last 23 days, of which 9 days (8 nights) will be spent in the clinic.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a Phase 1, single-center, prospective, study of orally administered KUR-101 in normal healthy participants. The study will be conducted in two parts.
Part 1 is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled study to assess the safety, tolerability, PK, analgesic and respiratory effects of single ascending doses of orally administered KUR-101 in normal healthy participants. Once the MTD has been determined, this dose, or an alternate lower dose, will be taken into Part 2 of the study.
Part 2 is a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, three-period crossover study to assess the analgesic and respiratory effects of a single oral KUR-101 as compared to that of oxycodone in normal healthy participants.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Safety of KUR-101 when compared with placebo
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the signing of the informed consent through Day 8 in Cohort 1, 2, 4 and 5 and through Day 15 in Cohort 3
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events

primary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Effect of KUR-101 on evoked pain response as compared to oxycodone and placebo
primary_outcome.description: Measured using the cold pressor test

primary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Effect of KUR-101 on evoked pain response as compared to oxycodone and placebo

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1 and Part 2: Pharmacokinetics of KUR-101
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by levels of KUR-101 in the blood
Measured by levels of KUR-101 in the urine

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Effect of KUR-101 on respiratory function when compared to placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using continuous end-tidal capnography monitoring

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Effect of KUR-101 on respiratory function when compared to placebo
Part 1: Effect of KUR-101 on respiratory function when compared to placebo
Part 2: Effect of KUR-101 on respiratory function when compared to placebo and oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: Measured using continuous end-tidal capnography monitoring

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Effect of KUR-101 on respiratory function when compared to placebo and oxycodone
Part 2: Effect of KUR-101 on respiratory function when compared to placebo and oxycodone
Part 2: Safety of KUR-101 when compared with placebo and oxycodone
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the signing of the informed consent through Day 22
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Addictive potential of KUR-101 when compared with placebo and oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: Measured through the Desire for Opioids visual acuity scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Addictive potential of KUR-101 when compared with placebo and oxycodone
secondary_outcome.description: Measured through the Addiction Research Center Inventory Morphine Benzedrine Group scale

other_outcome.measure: Part 1: Effect of KUR-101 on evoked pain response as compared to placebo
other_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to 4 hours post dose
other_outcome.description: Measured using the cold pressor test

other_outcome.measure: Part 1: Addictive potential of KUR-101 when compared with placebo
other_outcome.description: Measured through the Desire for Opioids visual acuity scale

other_outcome.measure: Part 1: Addictive potential of KUR-101 when compared with placebo
other_outcome.description: Measured through the Addiction Research Center Inventory Morphine Benzedrine Group scale

arm_group.description: Single dose of oral KUR-101 or oral placebo
Single dose of oral KUR-101, oral placebo and oral OxyNorm
